Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: ngOnchange not get triggerd when passing input dynamically in angular 9 with IVY?
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ngOnchange hook for for complex directive not get triggered while i pass inputs dynamically, ### Affected Package no ides ### Is this a regression? yes, in angular 8 it is working fine ### Description i have directive for my component and i initialize inputs for my directive as below but ngonchange hook not get triggeres in angular 9 IVY ### component structure ``` * * * * * * ``` ### item-directive.ts ``` let input: string[] = ['content', 'cssClass', 'disabled', 'header', 'headerTemplate', 'visible']; let outputs: string[] = []; /** * TabItem complex Directive * @private */ @Directive({ selector: 'e-tabitems>e-tabitem', inputs: input, outputs: outputs, queries: { } }) export class TabItemDirective extends ComplexBase { public cssClass: any; public disabled: any; public header: any; public visible: any; @ContentChild('content') @Template() public content: any; @ContentChild('headerText') @Template() public header_text: any; @ContentChild('headerTemplate') @Template() public headerTemplate: any; constructor(private viewContainerRef:ViewContainerRef) { super(); setValue('currentInstance', this, this.viewContainerRef); this.registerEvents(outputs); } } /** * TabItem Array Directive * @private */ @Directive({ selector: 'my-tab>e-tabitems', queries: { children: new ContentChildren(TabItemDirective) }, }) export class TabItemsDirective extends ArrayBase { constructor() { super('items'); } } ``` hooks for my complex and array directive has been exected in complexbase and arraybase class which i extended here here i have set input properties in different way and i got some info from [here](https://www.bennadel.com/blog/3541-ngonchanges-life-cycle-hook-only-gets-invoked-if-calling-context-actually-provides-input-bindings-in-angular-7-1-1.htm) But in this way of setting input properties working fine in angular 8 but not working in anglar 9 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. download below sample [checkone.zip](https://github.com/angular/angular/files/4228726/checkone.zip) 2. give `npm i` 3. then `ng serve` i have generated my coomponent package using ng-packagr which will get downloaded while giving `npm i` ## üî• Exception or Error control not get rendered ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: fix(core): handle synthetic props in Directive host bindings correctly
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, animations-related runtime logic assumed that the `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` with synthetic (animations) props are used for Components only. However having `@HostBinding` and `@HostListener` with synthetic props on Directives is supported by View Engine. This commit updates the logic to select correct renderer to execute instructions (current renderer for Directives and sub-component renderer for Components).

This PR resolves #35501.

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/platform-server

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Http Proxy configuration for Platform Server Http

When doing Server Side Rendering through Angular Universal, Angular makes XHR requests to services. If the environment (may be highly regulated) requires that these requests are made through a HttpProxy -- these requests will fail. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 

This is directly related to this bug filed with @angular/universal https://github.com/angular/universal/issues/887

Though the proper solution may involve changes to https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/platform-server/src/http.ts

Ideally an injection token for HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY should be provided in the SSR instance of the app.

It seems the underlying issue is that `xhr2` does not support proxying out of the box, so some of this functionality may need to be bolted on. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> The only reasonable workaround is implementing code within the app similar to https://github.com/angular/universal/issues/887

Issues.Title: A new FormControl instance can disable an input, but it can't enable it
Issues.Body:
Angular 9.0.0

As form controls can disable inputs, it seems like a bug that they can't enable them. Or is it a feature request? It works if you only work with a single FormControl instance. But if you give an disabled input a new FormControl instance, you are stuck.

Reproduction https://ng-run.com/edit/eXsAwaGca33ShZmNXh7v

Click on `create enabled FormControl` and the input stays enabled. Click at least once on `create disabled FormControl`, and the enabled control won't kick the input out of the disabled state. And it doesn't inherit the disabled state from the input either.

I guess the disabled state it taken care of in https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/forms/src/directives/reactive_directives/form_control_directive.ts#L188-L190, just the reverse is missing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A new FormControl instance can disable an input, but it can't enable it" (#35565)

Issues.Title: fix(core): support sanitizer value in the [style] bindings
Issues.Body:
When binding to `[style]` we correctly sanitized/unwrapped properties but we did not do it for the object itself.

```
@HostBinding("style")
style: SafeStyle = this.sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustStyle(
    "background: red; color: white; display: block;"
  );
```

Above code would fail since the `[style]` would not unwrap the `SafeValue` and would treat it as object resulting in incorrect behavior.

Fix #35476 (FW-1875)

Issues.Title: fix(localize): support minified ES5 `$localize` calls
Issues.Body:
Some minification tooling modifies `$localize` calls
to contain a comma sequence of items, where the
cooked and raw values are assigned to variables.

This change improves our ability to recognize these
structures.

Fixes #35376
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(localize): support minified ES5 `$localize` calls" (#35562)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): infer context type of structural directives (#35537)
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [X] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [X] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: #35537, #35426

## What is the new behavior?

The type of structural directive context is now correctly inferred instead of any. There was a trick before to manually handle the context of ngFor exported values (getNgForExportedValueType function), this is not needed anymore, because my solutions handle them automatically. New unit tests were added to validate this change and also to ensure the fix is actually working.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

The implementation works like in angular 8, because it relies on the already existing getTemplateContext method. So the context is inferred from the type parameter of injected TemplateRef. The ivy compiler works differently by relying on ngTemplateContextGuard static method. However, the TemplateRef solution will work with much more existing directives and as I understand, full ivy parity was not scope of language-service v9.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(language-service): infer context type of structural directives (#35537)" (#35561)

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): do not break when cookies are disabled in the browser
Issues.Body:
Whenever cookies are disabled in the browser, `window.localStorage` is not avaialable to the app (i.e. even trying to access `window.localStorage` throws an error).

To avoid breaking the app, we use a no-op `Storage` implementation if `window.localStorage` is not available.

(This is similar to #33829, but for `localStorage` instead of `sessionStorage`.)

Fixes #35555.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(docs-infra): do not break when cookies are disabled in the browser" (#35557)

Issues.Title: Child injector created by Injector.create() should be able to provide dependencies needed by parent
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
*Please see https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-providing-dependency-in-child-injector for the demo app.*

It would be great to be able to dynamically create service instances by providing their dependency values at arbitrary moments during the lifetime of an application.

I thought it should be a pretty common use case for the Angular DI system. I'd like to register a provider for a service (`Service2` in the demo app) declaratively at compile time. This service would have a dependency (`SERVICE2_MODE`) that doesn't have a provider registered at compile time.

At a certain moment during the application runtime I have a value for that missing dependency (`SERVICE2_MODE`) and now I need to instantiate the service (`Service2`) using that specific value.

I would expect that Angular supports a possibility to do this by manually creating a child injector for the root injector, giving the child injector a provider for `SERVICE2_MODE`, and then calling `childInjector.get(Service2)`. However, this does not work, because the `Service2` provider is registered at the root injector, and when the root injector tries to instantiate it, it is unaware that the child injector has a provider for that dependency.

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would make sense if each dependency provider lookup would go through the full injector hierarchy, starting from the `childInjector`, until it reaches the null injector. Currently, if a provider is not registered at `childInjector`, the lookup continues at the parent injector, but the dependencies for that provider are never tried to be resolved at the `childInjector` level.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Currently in our production app, we simply don't use Angular DI for such cases. `Service1` and `Service2` are not decorated with `@Injectable()` and are manually instantiated inside `Service1FactoryService`.

But this means: tight coupling, inability to properly test Service1FactoryService, inability to handle complex dependency hierarchies.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Child injector created by Injector.create() should be able to provide dependencies needed by parent" (#35548)

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> When loading component lazily (or just creating component dynamically) and you don't have it declared anywhere in modules, you can't access any features from this component, unless you load them also lazily in component or you create workaround module for this specific component to specify what imports you want to use in this component.


### Why I need this
Main problem for me is that I have many components that are dynamically created and inserted. They are all declared in one file and then declared in also one module which has some shared module imported (This SharedModule is something I need in loaded components too). Now since I don't have to write the component in entryComponents and also it is not necessary to write it in declarations either, I want to remove this file containing the set of components.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I'm not very familiar with angular source code, so I can't really make clear suggestions, but I think it will be possible since ivy now is much more dynamic to add features to component instance when calling ViewContainerRef.createComponent. So I think it would be wonderful if it was possible to set module same as caller module for created component too, of course if it isn't already declared in any of the modules (I hope ViewContainerRef somehow knows in which module opener component is declared).


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
The way to fix my problem is to declare all of those components into their own logical modules, or create separate modules for each of the components, but that's quite extra work to do and I don't understand why this should be required when I think it will be a lot easier to give those components opener's module (Or if it is possible to somehow find workaround to add module on my own when calling createComponent please let me know how).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Auto module declaration for lazy loaded components" (#35545)

Issues.Title: ng-add doesn't install the latest version correctly
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [x] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes. With `@angular/cli@8` doesn't cause that error. ### Description In a project created by `@angular/cli@latest`, `ng add` command seems not working correctly. Executing `ng add @ngrx/store`, it throws an error. ``` $ ng add @ngrx/store Installing packages for tooling via yarn. Installed packages for tooling via yarn. The package that you are trying to add does not support schematics. You can try using a different version of the package or contact the package author to add ng-add support. error Command failed with exit code 1. ``` But adding `@latest` to the `@ngrx/store`, it installs and runs schematics of `@ngrx/store`. ``` ng add @ngrx/store@latest Package has unmet peer dependencies. Adding the package may not succeed. Installing packages for tooling via yarn. Installed packages for tooling via yarn. CREATE src/app/reducers/index.ts (359 bytes) UPDATE src/app/app.module.ts (715 bytes) UPDATE package.json (1349 bytes) ‚úî Packages installed successfully. ‚ú® Done in 6.67s. ``` It seems Angular CLI's bug in `ng add` command. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create new project with the latest CLI (`npx @angular/cli@latest new my-app`) 2. Execute `ng add @ngrx/store` in the project. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Memory Leak when using ng
Issues.Body:
Hi,

There's a memory leak with `ng`, it keeps consuming memory despite memory increase, I've monitored and it has already **consumed more than 17 GB of RAM**! I think the problem is related to SASS because the program is stucked with `.scss` files but I'm not sure.


I've tested with `NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=17000` but also `node --max_old_space_size=20000 node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng build --prod` later, always the same issue even if I try with `8192` instead of `17000` or `20000`.

I know, this memory problem has already been opened multiple times, like here [#13734](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/13734), but it seems to be a **persistent issue**

Issues.Title: i18n sourceLocale: en-US with @angular/localize does not go to root folder, neither baseHref
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/localize


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> When doing ng build --localize e.g. for 3 languages, for default one en-US, en-GB, and nl, the ng build creates 3 folders inside dist which means there is no default files under dist, thus application can be only accessed with http://localhost:3000/en-US if you set port to 3000.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

Can we introduce default baseHref to be empty string "", and to add e.g. new property (`outputhPath`) to sourceLocale in angular.json to be root as default? 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?


I've found a way to add rsync command to extract default folder to root like this e.g.
`rsync -a dist/en-US/* dist/ && rm -rf dist/en-US` and to set baseHref property inside angular.json file with this: 

`"i18n": {
        "sourceLocale": {
          "baseHref": ""
        },
}`

This way, my app loads at _http://localhost:3000_ as usual.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "i18n sourceLocale: en-US with @angular/localize does not go to root folder, neither baseHref" (#17014)

Issues.Title: ng build needs to be optimized for docker
Issues.Body:
I use angular cli version 9, and I'm trying to run my app on docker, however, I don't want to install dev dependencies when doing a production build.

Unfortunately, angular-cli does not allows me to build my project using a globally installed cli, so every time I'm generating my docker image, I have to wait 5 min for installing @angular/cli and another 5 min to install the production packages.

On top of that angular takes around other 8 min to build my project, because it gets stuck on 92% for quite some time, and another 5 min to copy files over to my nginx public directory and spin de server. So basically we are talking about 23 min.

Notes: all docker cache gets invalidated with any changes on package.json, so considering that we are always adding/updating/removing a dependency, or bumping the version, we can't rely on cached layers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng build needs to be optimized for docker" (#17017)

Issues.Title: ng build is outputting to build progress to stderr stream
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/cli build process ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7.2.x (didn't test in 8.x - we went from 7.x to 9.0.1) ### Description When running `ng build` for our app on our Linux environment, we are seeing part of the build progress output to the stderr stream in linux. Note that we do not see this in windows or our docker environment, but in our production linux environment this is occuring. Not sure what the difference is between them, but I'm happy to help out to try to figure out what's causing this. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Here is the command we are running: `/usr/local/bin/npx ng build --prod --progress=false --deployUrl http://my.cdn.url.com 2> build-error.txt` Note that this is run immediately after running `npm ci` in our environment. This is part of a build server that is building the application prior to deployment, but it is currently failing due to the output on the stderr stream. ## üî• Exception or Error The contents of build-error.txt have been included in an attached file: [build-error.txt](https://github.com/angular/angular/files/4220452/build-error.txt). The contents of the console during the build have also been included, for completeness: [build-console-stdout-output.txt](https://github.com/angular/angular/files/4220453/build-console-stdout-output.txt). This should be empty, as there were no build errors during this build. Note - on windows and docker, we DO see 2 line feeds (\n\n) in the stderr, but these get stripped out by a call to .trim on the stderr stream. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular: 9.0.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router, upgrade
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.900.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.900.2
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.900.2
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.900.2
@angular-devkit/core              9.0.2
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.0.2
@angular/cdk                      9.0.0
@angular/cli                      9.0.2
@angular/material                 9.0.0
@ngtools/webpack                  9.0.2
@schematics/angular               9.0.2
@schematics/update                0.900.2
rxjs                              6.5.4
typescript                        3.7.5
webpack                           4.41.2
**Anything else relevant?** ``` $ npm -v 6.13.4 $ node -v v12.16.0 $ npx -v 6.13.4 ``` This is running as root on an AWS EC2 instance with Amazon Linux.

Issues.Title: AOT Optimizer with Ivy enabled for a hybrid Angular/AngularJS app doesn't include all the necessary components
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, it used to work with the 8.x versions because Ivy was not enabled by default. However, it still works correctly with Ivy disabled, so it's not a critical regression. ### Description For a hybrid Angular/AngularJS application, having Ivy, AOT and the Optimizer enabled will prevent the production bundle to contain all the necessary components. Disabling any of those 3 (Ivy, AOT, or the Optimizer) will allow the builder to include all the used components. This issue seems to be related to the fact that AngularJS is in charge of the routing and the missing components are only used in AngularJS templates. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. You can checkout this project: https://github.com/maximecarlier/angular-hybrid-ivy-bug 2. Run `npm i` 3. Run `ng serve` and see that the string "Angular/AngularJS Hybrid" is displayed 4. Run `ng serve --prod` and see that that's not the case anymore 5. Possible actions with the same result: * Disable Ivy (in `tsconfig.json`, set `angularCompilerOptions.enableIvy` to false) * Disable AOT (in `angular.json`, set `projects.angular-test.architect.build.options.aot` to false) * Disable the scripts optimization (in `angular.json`, set `projects.angular-test.architect.build.configurations.production.optimization.scripts` to false) 6. Run `ng serve --prod` and see that the string appears again ## üî• Exception or Error No exception or error, the components are just not part of the bundle file for production. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.2
Node: 12.13.0
OS: linux x64

Issues.Title: Font loading inconsistently fails since Angular 9 upgrade
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [X ] build ### Is this a regression? Yes, was not happening in Angular 8. ### Description Since upgrading to Angular 9, I'm experiencing very strange behaviour with font loading in Chrome. Occasionally (and sadly inconsistently), the font is failing to load without error resulting in fallback to the system font. The font will load sometimes on a refresh - even when loading a cached copy. A hard refresh will always fix the font loading, but the problem will reoccur after some time. This has been next to impossible for me to reproduce consistently but occurs with this font: http://zavoloklom.github.io/material-design-iconic-font/ One thing I have noticed is that since Angular 9, fonts are now appearing in the Chrome Developer tools Sources panel when they never used to previously. Are there any recommendations for what I can do to get to the root cause of the issue? ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Force single quote for *.ts files in .editorconfig
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
When saving typescript files, my editor format my code and change single quoted string to double quote.
I use Prettier, tslint and editorconfig extensions and I didn't change anything in my vs-code settings so i don't know where the problem comes from..

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be simple to force strings in typescript files to have single quote within .editorconfig file.
Just add:
```editorconfig
[*.ts]
quote_type = single
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Force single quote for *.ts files in .editorconfig" (#17012)

Issues.Title: Templates are processed too early
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

Having the `AngularCompilerPlugin` in a custom steup instantiated like this

```js
new AngularCompilerPlugin({
    platform: 0,
    mainPath: config.isTest
      ? config.frontend.entry.test
      : config.frontend.entry.main,
    tsConfigPath: config.isTest
      ? config.frontend.tsconfigTestFile
      : config.frontend.tsconfigAppFile,

    skipCodeGeneration: !config.isAot,
    sourceMap: true,
    forkTypeChecker: true,
    directTemplateLoading: false,

    compilerOptions: {
      fullTemplateTypeCheck: true,
      strictInjectionParameters: true,
      strictTemplates: false,
      enableIvy: config.isIvy
    }
  })
```

and a webpack rule for `.pug` templates 

```js
      {
        test: /\.(pug)$/,
        use: [{ loader: "apply-loader" }, { loader: "pug-loader" }]
      },
```

the templates are processed by the `ngtc` compiler without being transpiled to `.html`. The compiler fails when when template contains certain syntax with following error

```
  ERROR in Errors parsing template: Unexpected character "EOF" (Do you have an unescaped "{" in your template? Use "{{ '{' }}") to escape it.) ("h1 {{ title }}
  input([(ngModel)]="title", [ngModelOptions]="{ standalone: true }")
  router-outlet()
  [ERROR ->]"): /Users/alex/repositories/ginie/my-app/src/app/app.component.pug@3:0, Invalid ICU message. Missing '}'. ("h1 {{ title }}
  input([(ngModel)]="title", [ngModelOptions]="{ standalone: true }")
  router-outlet()
  [ERROR ->]"): /Users/alex/repositories/ginie/my-app/src/app/app.component.pug@3:0
```

- failure happens when compiled with `ivy` enabled and `aot` disabled
- failure does not happen with `ivy` and `aot` enabled
- fails only on certain syntax for example

this template would fail
```pug
h1 {{ title }}
input([(ngModel)]="title", [ngModelOptions]="{ standalone: true }")
```

but this template would not. Interestingly the application the renders correctly, as if the pug is transpiled at a later stage
```pug
h1 {{ title }}
input([(ngModel)]="title")
```


Adding a `console.log` at [node_modules/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/component](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9.0.x/packages/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/component.ts#L256) reveals that
- the `pug` content is processed when `aot` is off
- the `html` content is processed when `aot` is on

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Repo is here https://github.com/giniedp/angular-9-custom-pug-setup

```
git clone git@github.com:giniedp/angular-9-custom-pug-setup.git
cd angular-9-custom-pug-setup
yarn install
yarn build:custom
```

## üåç Your Environment
```
Angular CLI: 9.0.2
Node: 10.17.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.0.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

@schematics/angular               9.0.2

```

Issues.Title: ng update - Doesn't honor 'preserveSymlinks' flag, causes re-build for migrations to fail
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] update ### Is this a regression? unsure ### Description I have an angular cli project with npm symlinks to a different framework project. When running an update `ng update @angular/cli @angular/core rxjs`, it seems that the package update/installation phase doesn't honor the `"preserveSymlinks": true` setting. The result is that my framework symlink is removed, which causes the project to fail compilation so the migrations don't all run correctly. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```bash npm i -g @angular/cli@8.3.25 mkdir ng-up cd ng-up ng new framework cd framework ng g lib @myfw/model ng build @myfw/model cd ./dist/myfw/model npm link cd ../../../.. ng new app cd app npm link @myfw/model #edit ./app/src/app/app.module.ts to the below (importing ModelModule from @myfw/model #edit ./app/angular.json, add `preserveSymlinks: true` ng serve #The app runs as expected ``` app/src/app/app.module.ts ```typescript import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser'; import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'; import { AppComponent } from './app.component'; import { ModelModule } from '@myfw/model' //<- Add this from @myfw/model @NgModule({ declarations: [ AppComponent ], imports: [ BrowserModule, ModelModule //<- Add this from @myfw/model ], providers: [], bootstrap: [AppComponent] }) export class AppModule { } ``` upgrade process ```bash npm i -g @angular/cli #Update angular cli to 9.0.2 cd ../framework ng update @angular/cli @angular/core rxjs --force #--force is needed for tsickle ng build @myfw/model cd ../app ng update @angular/cli @angular/core rxjs ``` get error as seen below. `ls ./node_modules/@myfw` shows no directories, the symlinks have been deleted. ## üî• Exception or Error 

> Undecorated classes with DI migration.
  As of Angular 9, it is no longer supported to use Angular DI on a class that does not have an Angular decorator.
  Read more about this here: https://v9.angular.io/guide/migration-undecorated-classes

    This migration uses the Angular compiler internally and therefore projects that no longer build successfully after the update cannot run the migration. Please ensure there are no AOT compilation errors and rerun the migration. The following project failed: tsconfig.app.json

    Error: error TS100: src\app\app.module.ts(13,5): Error during template compile of 'AppModule'
      Could not resolve @myfw/model relative to [object Object]..
    error TS100: src\app\app.module.ts(13,5): Error during template compile of 'AppModule'
      Could not resolve @myfw/model relative to [object Object]..


    Could not migrate all undecorated classes that use dependency
    injection. Some project targets could not be analyzed due to
    TypeScript program failures.

    Migration can be rerun with: "ng update @angular/core --migrate-only migration-v9-undecorated-classes-with-di"

  Migration completed.
## üåç Your Environment @angular/cli 8.3.25 to start (to generate the original projects)

Issues.Title: Support transpile async await for ES2017 target
Issues.Body:

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
Now Angular can work properly for target `ES2015`, but if we want to build for target `ES2017`, the native `async/await` will not work because Zone.js can't monkey patch native `async/await`. (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/31730) But we still want the other ES2017+ native features.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

So if we can use some plugin of webpack with https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/tree/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_webpack, to process the bundle and only transpile the `async/await` code to `generator`, but keep all other ES2017+ code as native, it maybe a acceptable solution for now until we can find some other solutios.
### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you consid ered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support transpile async await for ES2017 target" (#16996)

Issues.Title: Allow custom "outputPath" directory for each locale
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] build

### Description
New version of Angular CLI allows us to use the new --localize option to generate different locales. This is great as it significantly reduces the build time for apps with many languages. However, as far as I can tell, the name of the output directory for each language is set to the name of the locale.
So if I have this locale defined:

`        "locales": {
          "foo-bar": {
            "translation": "src/i18n/messages.en-US.xlf"
          }
        }`

the output directory for this locale would be `/foo-bar`.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like to be able to specify outputPath per locale, ideally by just defining "outputPath" in each locale which would then be appended to existing build options outputPath.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Alternative is to just change name of the locale to the one I want. But this then creates a problem where LOCALE_ID is also changed. And I want my LOCALE_ID to be, for example en-US and my output directory of build to be /en.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow custom "outputPath" directory for each locale" (#16997)

Issues.Title: Mat-menu not allowing key strokes with menu items from components
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-7-mat-menu (works)
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-9-mat-menu (broken)

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Set up a button to be used with a mat-menu
2.  In the mat-menu, use 2 buttons as well as use a custom component that has just a button
3.  Using the keyboard, tab to your button and then open it, try to navigate using arrows
4.  Only the 2 buttons explicitly listed in the template will navigate, the button from the component will not allow keyboard navigation.  The manuData is missing for that element.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
This was working before we upgraded to version 9.  I have created 2 stackblitzes with the same example.  @angular 7 works,  @angular 8 and 9 do not. 


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The items that are listed as direct children are properly navigated to using arrow keys.  The ones rendered from custom component are skipped.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-menu not allowing key strokes with menu items from components" (#18553)

Issues.Title: build: do not ship load-example code to npm package
Issues.Body:
We don't want to ship the `load-example` code that is internal to our
dev-app and e2e-app to the `@angular/components-examples` package.

The logic for loading examples lazily can never be generic enough to
work in all environments. i.e. in Webpack, such dynamic imports which
are not statically analyzable cannot be resolved. This could result in
errors being thrown by Webpack about critical dependencies.

Marking as P3 since it's required for using the new examples package in the docs app.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: do not ship load-example code to npm package" (#18547)

Issues.Title: fix(material/select): run viewportRuler change event outside the zone
Issues.Body:
MatSelect component was listening viewportRuler change event inside the zone. Due to this, a CD cycle was fired after every 'resize' event, event there was nothing to detect changes. It only make sense to run a CD cycle if the mat-select panel is open.

Fixes #18546
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/select): run viewportRuler change event outside the zone" (#18548)

Issues.Title: Mat-select listens window 'resize' event inside the zone
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

1- Open the dev tools.
2- Resize the window.
3- See the console.log('Tick') being fired multiple times.

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nuyaqc

 
#### Expected Behavior

I expect that on window resize there isn't any CD run fired by mat-select component


#### Actual Behavior

Somehow mat-select component is listening window 'resize' event inside the zone, this fires a CD run on every 'resize' event. This CD run is not necessary since mat-select, as far as I know, doesn't react on window changes, and if so, it should do it outside the zone and detecting changes locally IMO.


#### Environment

- Angular: ~9.0.0
- CDK/Material: ~9.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome (latest)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-select listens window 'resize' event inside the zone" (#18546)

Issues.Title: Input Radio Group touched and focus Accessibility Issue
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.  Specifically if the right or down arrow is pressed via the keyboard.  

-------->

#### What are you trying to do?

Understand the relationship of touched and focus on a input radio group that is linked to a Reactive Form.  This is in relation to WCAG Accessibility and Usability.

The focus is set on the input but the touched isn't fired until after the focus is lost.  This behavior can cause an unexpected behavior in a keyboard only environment.

In this scenario the keyboard user needs to use the arrow keys to navigate the options provided.  The user cannot go to the next option without a delay of checking the value of touched.

I'm not sure this is the correct place for this question.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

Adding a delay does fix this problem, but it also causes some unintended consequences such as the jumping of focus.

What are you seeing that does not match your expectations?   

There is a delay in the firing of touched when using keyboard navigation.  Is this expected behavior?

#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-b36sfr

Keyboard only mode

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Tab through selections on first field group (incorrect behavior)
2.  Tab through second radio button group (correct behavior)
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Input Radio Group touched and focus Accessibility Issue" (#18543)

Issues.Title: Mat-chip steals focus from other element
Issues.Body:
Hi,

I have a strange issue when using mat-chip-list with mat-chip. Every time I change something in mat-chip, eg. class or make angular to reflect change in object, mat-chip which was changed gets focus by browser even that I disabled it for selection.

```
<mat-chip-list [selectable]="false">
  <ng-container *ngFor="let item of items">
    <mat-chip [selectable]="false" (click)="onItemSelected(item)"
      [ngClass]="{'selected': item?.id === +selectedItemId, 'new-message': item?.newMessage}">
    </mat-chip>
  </ng-container>
</mat-chip-list>
```

Basically there is a text box on this page. User is typing some text and when in upper menu any change happens, this text box lose focus and user has to refocus it again manually.
Did I miss something in documentation?

Thank you for any advice
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-chip steals focus from other element" (#18542)

Issues.Title: fix(a11y): focus trap incorrectly moving focus internally if focus was already moved into it
Issues.Body:
The new `ConfigurableFocusTrap` uses a timeout to allow for focus to be moved before it traps focus into itself, however if focus was moved into it before the timeout has fired, focus will be incorrectly moved to the first element in the trap. These changes add an extra check that ensures that focus isn't moved again if it's already inside the trap.

Relates to #18538.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(a11y): focus trap incorrectly moving focus internally if focus was already moved into it" (#18541)

Issues.Title: fix(overlay): incorrectly calculating using minWidth and minHeight as a string
Issues.Body:
We use `minWidth` and `minHeight` to figure out whether an overlay can fit with its flexible dimensions. The problem is that the values can be either a string or a number, and if they're a string, the comparison breaks down because the value we're comparing it against is always a number.

These changes also add a couple of extra tests for `minWidth` and `minHeight` since we didn't have any.

Fixes #18486.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(overlay): incorrectly calculating using minWidth and minHeight as a string" (#18540)

Issues.Title: Datepicker dependencies docs
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

When using MatMomentDateModule, it's not obvious *how* to get it working from the docs. Even googling gets you to slightly droll posts like https://github.com/angular/components/issues/12887 

**Affected documentation page:** 

If you go here:
https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview#choosing-a-date-implementation-and-date-format-settings 

It says to install moment.

If you go to Moment, it says to do:

`npm i moment`

You still get an error from `import { MatMomentDateModule }`

You must also do:

`npm i @angular/material-moment-adapter`

While Angular could probably say "that's Moment's issue" and Moment could say "No, that's Material's issue" I think it would be best to mention on the doc page here: 

https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview#choosing-a-date-implementation-and-date-format-settings 

To say:

To install 
`npm i moment`
`npm i @angular/material-moment-adapter`

In your module:
`import { MatMomentDateModule, MomentDateAdapter } from "@angular/material-moment-adapter"; `

While https://github.com/angular/components/issues/12887  is certainly dead accurate, it shouldn't be necessary to google all over the place due to documentation terseness. 

My guess: Most large development projects already have a package.json and an app.module.ts that's just loaded with all kinds of junk, so "it' just works". I was doing a coding challenge and going step by step and ran into this.

There are three other similar bugs, all of them locked, and none with a resolution. 

(I do find in general, while the documentation is very beautiful, the "TS" tabs frequently don't show the proper module imports). 

Seriously - big thumbs up to the look and feel of the docs, and the amazing completeness in most areas. Let's get it the rest of the way!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Datepicker dependencies docs" (#18539)

Issues.Title: PendingCopy moves focus to top of FocusTrap
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug: When using a `PendingCopy` via `xapCopyToClipboard` inside a `cdkTrapFocus` element, the focus gets moved to the first focusable element of the FocusTrap area.

#### What is the expected behavior?
I expect the focus to remain on the `xapCopyToClipboard` element, as it does when not in a `cdkTrapFocus` element.

#### What is the current behavior?
The focus moves to the first focusable element of the FocusTrap area when the `xapCopyToClipboard` element is clicked.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
The existing behavior is confusing and unexpected. It causes focus to move without reason and can cause the page to scroll significantly.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
The issue is caused by the `_textarea` element of [PendingCopy](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/clipboard/pending-copy.ts#L36), which is appended to the `<body>`. Naturally, the body element will be outside of any `cdkTrapFocus` element, so the `cdkTrapFocus` gets triggered whenever the `copy()` method gets called.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PendingCopy moves focus to top of FocusTrap" (#18538)

Issues.Title: PeerDependency bug
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. `ng update packageThatDependsOnMaterial8`
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
It updates `packageThatDependsOnMaterial8`, as well as updating Material/CDK to 8.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
```
                  Package "@keysight/alloy" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/common" (requires "^8.1.1", would install "9.0.1")
                  Package "@keysight/alloy" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/core" (requires "^8.1.1", would install "9.0.1")
                  Package "@keysight/alloy" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/cdk" (requires "^8.2.3", would install "9.0.0")
                  Package "@keysight/alloy" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/material" (requires "^8.2.3", would install "9.0.0")
                  Package "@keysight/alloy" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/cdk" (requires "^8.2.3", would install "9.0.0").
                  Package "@keysight/alloy" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/material" (requires "^8.2.3", would install "9.0.0").
                  Package "@angular-devkit/build-angular" has an incompatible peer dependency to "typescript" (requires ">=3.1 < 3.6", would install "3.7.5").

Incompatible peer dependencies found.
Peer dependency warnings when installing dependencies means that those dependencies might not work correctly together.
You can use the '--force' option to ignore incompatible peer dependencies and instead address these warnings later.
```

#### Environment

- Angular: 8
- CDK/Material: 8

Alloy `peerDependencies`:
```
    "peerDependencies": {
        "@angular/common": "^8.1.1",
        "@angular/core": "^8.1.1",
        "@angular/cdk": "^8.2.3",
        "@angular/material": "^8.2.3"
    },
```

This seems to be the culprit (Material peerDependencies):
```
  "peerDependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "^8.0.0 || ^9.0.0-0",
    "@angular/cdk": "8.2.3",
    "@angular/core": "^8.0.0 || ^9.0.0-0",
    "@angular/common": "^8.0.0 || ^9.0.0-0",
    "@angular/forms": "^8.0.0 || ^9.0.0-0"
  }
```

Currently, we're instructing our consumers to remove Material, upgrade Alloy, then restore Material.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PeerDependency bug" (#18536)

Issues.Title: refactor: use jasmine expectAsync instead of try/catch in tests
Issues.Body:
Currently tests that assert errors to be thrown/or not from
asynchronous methods use `try/catch` in order to use `await`.

We added a helper method for this in the private testing utilities. This
one reduced the `try/catch` burden. That helper method has downsides
though because it doesn't allow us to expect no error to be thrown.

We should remove this method in favor of using jasmine's `expectAsync`
function. This one gives us more flexibility and is also more
"jamsine"-idiomatic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: use jasmine expectAsync instead of try/catch in tests" (#18535)

Issues.Title: cdk drag: add ability to update internal _activeTransform
Issues.Body:
I want to use `cdkDrag` for the dragging part of a custom scrollbar. But the thing is, the native scroll occurs, I apply transform3d to the custom scrollbar thumb, which is simultaneously the drag handle, now when I try to drag after scroll occurred, those transforms get all messed up.

So ideally I would like to be able to sync those values.

This works:

```
(this.cdkDragYRef as any)._dragRef._activeTransform.y = this._scrollbarPosition.y;
(this.cdkDragXRef as any)._dragRef._activeTransform.x = this._scrollbarPosition.x;
```

Issues.Title: feat(datepicker): polish up date range selector
Issues.Body:
Makes a bunch of changes to polish up the behavior of the date range picker.

- Makes the range selection logic a bit smarter about when to pick start/end so that it's more intuitive.
- Fixes hovering over disabled cells triggering the range selection styles.
- Fixes a "changed after checked" error when selecting a range using the keyboard.
- Implements validation that the start isn't after the end, and that the end isn't before the start.
- Adds the missing ARIA attributes.
- Fixes being able to select the placeholders of a disabled range input.
- Adds the ability to disable the entire range input.
- Fixes the inputs not graying out their values when they're disabled.
- Makes the range input a bit smarter about which input to focus on click.

With these changes the date range picker should be mostly feature-complete.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(datepicker): polish up date range selector" (#18531)

Issues.Title: feat(form-field): expose label content element id for custom controls
Issues.Body:
Currently, the form-field always creates a label element as sibling
to projected form-field controls. For native controls, the label is
associated with the controls using the `for` attribute.

This doesn't work for custom controls which might not be based
on native controls. e.g. the `mat-select`. In those cases, the
appropriate aria attributes need to be applied with `aria-labelledby`
that refers to the label content element.

Since this is a common pattern for custom controls that don't use
native controls, we need to expose the element id for the label content.

Currently we already do this for the select, but just prefixed it with
an underscore. This denotes it as private API while there is obviously a
use-case for exposing this publicly. Best example is how the select _needs_ it.

**Note**: If we decide to go with that change, the target is usually `minor`, but it might be worth checking if we could get it into `master` earlier for our MDC form-field changes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(form-field): expose label content element id for custom controls" (#18528)
